quote: So far as I am acquainted with the principles and doctrines of Freemasonry, I conceive it to be founded in benevolence and to be exercised only for the good of mankind.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Fredericksburg Lodge No. 4, Virginia
Charter Worshipful Master of Alexandria Lodge No. 22
source: Letter to the Grand Lodge of Maryland, November 8, 1798

quote: Being persuaded that a just application of the principles on which the Masonic fraternity is founded must be promotive of private virtue and public prosperity, I shall always be happy to advance the interests of the Society.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Fredericksburg Lodge No. 4, Virginia
Charter Worshipful Master of Alexandria Lodge No. 22
source: Address to the Masons of Newport, Rhode Island, 1791

quote: I sincerely wish that the conduct of every member of the fraternity, as well as those publications that discover the principles which actuate them, may tend to convince mankind that the great object of Masonry is the promotion of virtue and the happiness of mankind.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Fredericksburg Lodge No. 4, Virginia
Charter Worshipful Master of Alexandria Lodge No. 22
source: Letter to King David's Lodge in Newport, Rhode Island, 1790

quote: To enlarge the sphere of social happiness is worthy of the benevolent design of a Masonic institution; the grand object of Masonry is to promote the happiness of the human race.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Fredericksburg Lodge No. 4, Virginia
Charter Worshipful Master of Alexandria Lodge No. 22
source: Letter to the Grand Lodge of Massachusetts, January 1793

quote: Freemasonry is founded on the immutable laws of truth and justice, and its grand object is to promote the happiness of the human race.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Fredericksburg Lodge No. 4, Virginia
Charter Worshipful Master of Alexandria Lodge No. 22
source: Statement on the purpose of Freemasonry, attributed

quote: Masonic labor is purely a labor of love. He who seeks to draw Masonic wages in gold and silver will be disappointed.
masonicTitles: Past Grand Master, Grand Lodge of Pennsylvania
source: Attributed Masonic address on the "wages of a Mason"

quote: Freemasonry is a moral order, instituted by virtuous men with the praiseworthy design of recalling to our remembrance the most sublime truths.
masonicTitles: Member of St. Tammany Lodge No. 1 (later Harmony Lodge No. 1)
Grand Master of the Grand Lodge of Tennessee, 1822–1824
source: Masonic Address, Tennessee (attributed contemporary record)

quote: Freemasonry is an institution calculated to benefit mankind.
masonicTitles: Member of St. Tammany Lodge No. 1 (later Harmony Lodge No. 1)
Grand Master of the Grand Lodge of Tennessee, 1822–1824
source: Masonic Address, Tennessee (attributed contemporary record)

quote: I have long been connected with the Masonic Fraternity, and I trust I shall never do anything unworthy of the character of a Mason.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Columbia Lodge No. 31, Tennessee
Companion in Royal Arch Masonry
Knight Templar
source: Statement recorded by the Grand Lodge of Tennessee (Polk Papers)

quote: I became a Mason long before I entered public life, and I have ever been grateful for the lessons of charity and brotherly love which the institution teaches.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Lodge No. 43, Lancaster, Pennsylvania
source: Recorded by Pennsylvania Grand Lodge archives (public address summary)

quote: The spirit of Masonry is the spirit of kindness, helpfulness, and brotherly love.
masonicTitles: Raised in Hiram Lodge No. 21, Winchester, Virginia
source: Masonic remarks recorded during political address (Ohio Masonic archives)

quote: I am glad to meet my brethren of the Masonic fraternity and to acknowledge my allegiance to the principles which have guided so many good and noble men.
masonicTitles: Raised in Hiram Lodge No. 21, Winchester, Virginia
source: Masonic gathering, recorded in Ohio Grand Lodge proceedings

quote: I violate no secret when I say that one of the greatest values in Masonry is that it affords an opportunity for men of all walks of life to meet on common ground where all men are equal.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Matinecock Lodge No. 806, Oyster Bay, New York
source: Masonic Address, 1902

quote: Freemasonry teaches not merely temperance, fortitude, prudence, justice, brotherly love, relief, and truth, but liberty, equality, and fraternity.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Matinecock Lodge No. 806, Oyster Bay, New York
source: Masonic speech attributed to Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The Masonic fraternity is one of the most helpful mediating and conserving organizations among men.
masonicTitles: Made a Mason at Sight in Kilwinning Lodge No. 356, Cincinnati, Ohio
source: Masonic Address, Ohio, early 1900s

quote: Masonry aims at the promotion of morality and higher living by rousing in man the instincts of charity and love of his kind.
masonicTitles: Made a Mason at Sight in Kilwinning Lodge No. 356, Cincinnati, Ohio
source: Address on the moral aims of Masonry

quote: I have seen the splendid work that Masonry is doing for our fellow man, and the more I come in contact with it the more impressed I am by its great charitable work.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Holland Lodge No. 8, New York
Honorary Grand Master, Order of DeMolay
32° Scottish Rite Mason
Noble, Ancient Arabic Order of the Nobles of the Mystic Shrine
source: Masonic Address, New York

quote: Freemasonry is a system of morals which makes it easier to live with your fellow man, whether he understands it or not.
masonicTitles: Past Grand Master of Masons in Missouri
33° Scottish Rite Mason
source: Letter to Senator Frank P. Briggs, 1939

quote: The greatest lessons I ever learned came from my Masonic brethren.
masonicTitles: Past Grand Master of Masons in Missouri
33° Scottish Rite Mason
source: Public Masonic remarks, Missouri archives

quote: Although I hold the highest civil honor in the world, I have always regarded my rank as a Past Grand Master of Masons the greatest honor that ever came to me.
masonicTitles: Past Grand Master of Masons in Missouri
33° Scottish Rite Mason
source: Remarks reflecting on his Masonic service

quote: Masonry has enriched my life immeasurably. It has taught me tolerance, charity, and the true meaning of brotherhood.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Malta Lodge No. 465, Grand Rapids, Michigan
33° Scottish Rite Mason
source: Scottish Rite Biennial Session Speech

quote: The Masonic order's work in the field of charity, education, and service is exemplary, and I am proud to be a Mason.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Malta Lodge No. 465, Grand Rapids, Michigan
33° Scottish Rite Mason
source: Scottish Rite Supreme Council remarks

quote: Masonic principles—internal, not external—and our order's vision of duty to country and acceptance of God as a Supreme Being have sustained me during my years of public service.
masonicTitles: Initiated, Passed, and Raised in Malta Lodge No. 465, Grand Rapids, Michigan
Master Mason, Columbia Lodge No. 3, Washington, D.C.
33° Scottish Rite Mason
Noble, Saladin Shriners
Honorary Grand Master, Order of DeMolay
source: Remarks at the George Washington Masonic National Memorial, 1975

quote: Freemasonry embraces the highest moral laws and will bear the test of any system of ethics or philosophy ever promulgated for the uplift of man.
masonicTitles: Master Mason, Manila Lodge No. 1, Philippines
Honorary Grand Master, Grand Lodge of the Philippines
source: Masonic address attributed to Douglas MacArthur

quote: There is no doubt in my mind that Masonry is the cornerstone of America.
masonicTitles: Master Mason, Sol. D. Bayless Lodge No. 359, Indiana
source: Quote attributed to Dave Thomas, Founder of Wendy's

quote: We Masons are among the fortunate ones who are taught to meet together with others of opposing convictions and yet respect each other as Brothers.
masonicTitles: Sovereign Grand Commander, Scottish Rite Southern Jurisdiction, USA
source: Masonic address attributed to Albert Pike

quote: No, dear brethren: the modern Mason works and should still work, so long as the world nurtures a tyrant or gathers the moans of the oppressed.
masonicTitles: Master Mason, Acacia Lodge No. 9, Madrid
Member, Solidaridad Lodge No. 53
source: Masonic oration, 1880s

quote: When I was a King and a Mason, a Master proven and skilled, I cleared me ground for a palace such as a King should build.
masonicTitles: Master Mason, Hope and Perseverance Lodge No. 782, Lahore
source: Poem "The Palace"

quote: Freemasonry has no dogma or theology. It teaches that it is important for every man to have a religion of his choice and to be faithful to it.
masonicTitles: Master Mason
Christian minister and author
source: Explanation of Masonic religious tolerance

quote: The Masonic fraternity is one of the most helpful mediating and conserving organizations among men, and I have never wavered from that impression.
masonicTitles: Southern Baptist pastor
Freemason
source: Address on the value of Freemasonry

quote: Masonry is the science of life in a society of men, by signs, symbols and ceremonies; its purpose is the perfection and happiness of the individual and the race.
masonicTitles: Masonic author
source: Masonic lecture on the nature of Masonry
